page.title: 03KING EDWARD VI SCHOOL.
page.content: King Edward VI School has two main blocks. One is called Bader Hall and this used to be a seperate school called Kings Hill School. First to third years are based there. It is named after Sir Douglas Bader who was a pilot in the Second World War. The other block is called Johnson Hall. This is the oldest building and fourth to sixth years are based there. It is named after Doctor Samuel Johnson who compiled the first English dictionary. There is also a Music block which has 3 classrooms and several practice rooms. The school is divided into 4 houses, Addison, Clinton, Darwin and Garrick. There are many inter-house competitions, such as athletics, music and swimming.
